intro: Rehmannia chingii, commonly known as the Chinese foxglove, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of violet to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Rehmannia chingii is valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
